segment.source: Configure the Windows Firewall Log (Windows 10)
segment.target: Configure the Windows Firewall Log (Windows 10)

segment.source: Configure the Windows Firewall Log
segment.target: Configure the Windows Firewall Log

segment.source: Configure the Windows Firewall Log
segment.target: Configure the Windows Firewall Log

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To configure Windows Firewall to log dropped packets or successful connections, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security node in the Group Policy Management MMC snap-in.
segment.target: To configure Windows Firewall to log dropped packets or successful connections, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security node in the Group Policy Management MMC snap-in.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: To configure the Windows Firewall log
segment.target: To configure the Windows Firewall log

segment.source: To configure the Windows Firewall log
segment.target: To configure the Windows Firewall log

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management Console to Windows Firewall with Advanced Security.

segment.source: In the details pane, in the Overview section, click Windows Firewall Properties.
segment.target: In the details pane, in the Overview section, click Windows Firewall Properties.

segment.source: For each network location type (Domain, Private, Public), perform the following steps.
segment.target: For each network location type (Domain, Private, Public), perform the following steps.

segment.source: Click the tab that corresponds to the network location type.
segment.target: Click the tab that corresponds to the network location type.

segment.source: Under Logging, click Customize.
segment.target: Under Logging, click Customize.

segment.source: The default path for the log is %windir%system32logfilesfirewallpfirewall.log.
segment.target: The default path for the log is %windir%system32logfilesfirewallpfirewall.log.

segment.source: If you want to change this, clear the Not configured check box and type the path to the new location, or click Browse to select a file location.
segment.target: If you want to change this, clear the Not configured check box and type the path to the new location, or click Browse to select a file location.

segment.source: Important: The location you specify must have permissions assigned that permit the Windows Firewall service to write to the log file.
segment.target: Important: The location you specify must have permissions assigned that permit the Windows Firewall service to write to the log file.

segment.source: The default maximum file size for the log is 4,096 kilobytes (KB).
segment.target: The default maximum file size for the log is 4,096 kilobytes (KB).

segment.source: If you want to change this, clear the Not configured check box, and type in the new size in KB, or use the up and down arrows to select a size.
segment.target: If you want to change this, clear the Not configured check box, and type in the new size in KB, or use the up and down arrows to select a size.

segment.source: The file will not grow beyond this size; when the limit is reached, old log entries are deleted to make room for the newly created ones.
segment.target: The file will not grow beyond this size; when the limit is reached, old log entries are deleted to make room for the newly created ones.

segment.source: No logging occurs until you set one of following two options:
segment.target: No logging occurs until you set one of following two options:

segment.source: To create a log entry when Windows Firewall drops an incoming network packet, change Log dropped packets to Yes.
segment.target: To create a log entry when Windows Firewall drops an incoming network packet, change Log dropped packets to Yes.

segment.source: To create a log entry when Windows Firewall allows an inbound connection, change Log successful connections to Yes.
segment.target: To create a log entry when Windows Firewall allows an inbound connection, change Log successful connections to Yes.

segment.source: Click OK twice.
segment.target: Click OK twice.
